div.p: I think that yes there has been massive times through but they didn’t wake up one day and say oh this isn’t working bang it’s a period
of prolonged exposure to it I think that led me into alcoholism and a month-long stay in a mental hospital which actually looking back
with hindsight was probably the best place I’d ever been, that I needed to be at the time, the people I met there, the
fellow peers that were in there they weren’t all like One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest and all in padded jackets
they were normal people in there that just had adversity in their life and it had got too much and probably the peers and
the people that I could see had gone from that because we had a 12 month aftercare group and the people that I see that
had gone through that process I suppose and had come out the other side and were now making a success of their lives
and the burdens of the past, they were dealing with them but they were no longer shackled by them they were the people
that I took great solace from.
